Administrator Volume Replicator (VVR) SANPoint| homepage = }} 'Veritas
Software Corporation' was an international software company that was founded in
1983 as 'Tolerant Systems', renamed Veritas Software Corp. in 1989, and merged
with Symantec in 2005. It was headquartered in Mountain View, California. The
company specialized in storage management software including the first
commercial journaling file system, VxFS, VxVM, VCS, the personal/small office
backup software Backup Exec and the popular enterprise backup software
NetBackup. Veritas Record Now was the first worldwide popular CD recording
software, due to groundbreaking high reliability (a notable achievement at a
time when CD writers were a new technology), an easy user interface, and support
from hardware manufacturers. Veritas was listed on the S&P 500 and the NASDAQ-
100 under the VRTS ticker symbol.
